intro: Nothoscordum montevidense var. latitepalum, commonly known as the yellow false onion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its bulbous stems produce clusters of tubular flowers. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in garden settings.
